conclusion: To determine the trend of the acceleration of object B during the time interval 0 to t2, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph of object B.
The graph shows the velocity v as a function of time t.
The slope of the velocity-time graph gives the acceleration. A positive slope indicates positive acceleration, and a negative slope indicates negative acceleration.
From t = 0 to t = t1, the graph shows a downward curve, indicating that the velocity is decreasing.

premise: From t = 0 to t = t1, the graph shows a downward curve, indicating that the velocity is decreasing.
conclusion: The slope of the graph is negative, which means the acceleration is negative.
At t = t1, the graph reaches its minimum velocity.

premise: At t = t1, the graph reaches its minimum velocity.
conclusion: The slope of the graph is zero, which means the acceleration is zero.
From t = t1 to t = t2, the graph shows an upward curve, indicating that the velocity is increasing.

premise: From t = t1 to t = t2, the graph shows an upward curve, indicating that the velocity is increasing.
conclusion: The slope of the graph is positive, which means the acceleration is positive.

conclusion: The trend of the acceleration of object B during the time interval 0 to t2 is that it starts as negative, becomes zero at t = t1, and then becomes positive.
